# Introduction
## Plastic pollution


:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
### How much plastic? {.unnumbered}
- Ocean plastic flux: **11,000,000 Mt/y** [@reddy2020]
- Accelerating trend driven by **'business as usual'** [@oecd2022]
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### Where is the limit? {.unnumbered}
- Defined **9 planetary boundaries** [@rockstrom2009]
- **6/9** boundaries transgressed [@richardson2023]
- Production **outpaces safety assessment** [@persson2022]
:::

### Why is plastic so threatening? {.unnumbered}

- Plastic **is persistent** and **accumulates** in the ocean.
  - Plastic bags captured on camera at **10,000 m deep** [@jamieson2022]
  - High abundance of microplastics in **Arctic deep-sea sediment** [@bergmann2017]
- Engineered remediation is unlikely to succeed [@macleod2021]

::: footer
1 Introduction
:::

---

### What are the consequences to marine life? {.unnumbered}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="55%"}
- 17% of entangled *spp.* are IUCN **Red listed** [@gall2015]
- Seabirds (*Procellariiformes*) are **highly vulnerable** to poisoning [@savoca2016]
- **Invasive species** dispersion on top of plastic debris [@barnes2005]
:::

![](images/albatross.jpeg)
:::

## 'Bioplastics'
### What are they made of? {.unnumbered}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="60%"}
![](images/bioplastics-diagram.jpeg)
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
Compostable does not mean environmentally biodegradable, e.g. [@farah2016]: PLA needs **60 °C** to effectively degrade
:::
::::

::: footer
1 Introduction
:::

---

### Are they environmentally safe? {.unnumbered}

::: incremental
- Depends on polymer composition, salinity, T, microbial diversity [@lott2021]
- Many **do not degrade** at sea, e.g. PLA [@royer2023]
- **Lack of consensus** around biodegradation test methods [@lavagnolo2024]
- Environmental research falls behind leaving a **knowledge gap** [@ribba2022]
:::

::: footer
1 Introduction
:::

::: incremental
- Evaluate **Ecovio®** compostable plastic biodegradability
- Develop fast (**30 days**) BOD test method [based on @tosin2012]
- Propose **DEM** as a novel statistical tool for BOD prediction [@mason2006]
:::

# Materials and Methods

## Measuring principle
### How does biodegradation happen? {.unnumbered}

::: {.fragment}
$$
\require{mhchem}
\ce{Plastic + O2(g) ->[Microbes] Biomass + CO2 ^ + Minerals}
$$
:::

### How to quatify O~2~ consumption? {.unnumbered .fragment}

::: {.fragment}
$$\ce{CO2(aq) + 2Na^+ + 2OH^- + H2O->\\ Na2CO3v + 2H2O}$$
:::

---

Therefore, biodegradation becomes a **pressure measurement**,
$$PV = nRT \quad (V,T) \equiv const.$$

::: {.fragment}
Using **OxiTop® Control System**

![](images/oxitop.jpg){.absolute bottom=50 left=125 width="800"}
:::

```{r}

library(leaflet)

  popup = c("La Breña Reservoir", "Los Boliches Beach")

leaflet(samples) |> 
  addProviderTiles("Esri.WorldImagery") |> 
  addMarkers(~lng, ~lat, popup = ~popup) |>
```

## Statistical considerations
### How was ultimate biodegradability inferred? {.unnumbered}

Simple exponential model (**SEM**) [@hewitt1975]
$$BOD_t=BOD_u\ (1-e^{-kt})$$

::: {.fragment}
Double exponential model (**DEM**) [@mason2006]
$$BOD_t=BOD_{u1}(1-e^{-k_1t})+BOD_{u2}(1-e^{-k_2t})$$
:::

::: {.fragment}
Parameter estimation using *R* package `nls.multstart` [@padfield2025]
:::

::: footer
2 Materials and Methods
:::

---

### How was model selection performed? {.unnumbered}

Using Akaike information criterion (**AIC**) [@portet2020]

$$AIC = N \ln{\frac{RSS}{N}}+2K$$

::: footer
2 Materials and Methods
:::

::: {.notes}
number of observations $N$, residual sum of squares $RSS$, number of estimated parameters $K$
:::

## BOD test results

::: panel-tabset

#### Evolution

```{r}
data |> filter(time %% 5 == 0) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = time, y = bod, color = test)) +
  geom_point(aes(shape = test), stat = "summary", fun = median) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(fill = test), show.legend = F, alpha = .3, linetype = 0,
              stat = "summary", fun.min = min, fun.max = max) +
  geom_line(aes(linetype = test), stat = "summary", fun = median) +
  facet_wrap(~ medium, scales = "free_y",
             labeller = as_labeller(labels_medium)) +
  scale_color_discrete(name = NULL, labels = labels_test) +
  scale_linetype_manual(name = NULL, labels = labels_test,
                        values = c("dotted", "solid", "dashed")) +
  scale_shape_manual(name = NULL, labels = labels_test, values = c(0, 16, 1)) +
  labs(x = "Time (days)", y = "BOD (mg/L)") +
  theme(legend.position = "inside", legend.position.inside = c(.15, .8))
```

#### BOD

```{r}
data |> filter(time == 30) |> 
  group_by(medium, test) |> 
  summarize(median = median(bod), range = str_range(bod), 
            .groups = "drop") |> 
  left_join(t_tests, by = join_by(medium, test)) |> 
  mutate(
    median = round(median, 2),
    p.value = round(p.value, 5),
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    medium = fct_recode(medium, "Lake" = "lake", "Marine" = "sea"),
    test = fct_recode(test,
                           "Cellulose (+C)" = "paper",
                           "Ecovio®" = "plastic",
                           "Control (-C)" = "control")
  ) |>
  gt() |>
  cols_label(
    medium = "Env.", test = "Test",
    median = "Median (mg/L)", range = "[Min, Max] (mg/L)", p.value = "T-test (p-value)"
  ) |> 
  cols_align("left", test) |> cols_align("center", range) |> 
  sub_missing()
```
:::
